name: London Borough of Islington Quiz | London | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which part of London is the borough of Islington?
questions.explanation:
North.

	Islington is a North London borough, central Islington has the N1 postcode

questions.text: Which is the parish church of Islington?
questions.explanation:
St Mary.

	The current St Mary's church was rebuilt after bombing in World War II although the spire is original 17th century. Archbishop of Canterbury, George Carey, is a former curate there.

Theatre.

	Sadler's Wells theatre is built on the site of a reservoir developed by a Mr Sadler, hence the name. Sadler's Wells is particularly known for ballet productions.

questions.text: Which political party took power in Islington Council in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Liberal Democrats.

	The Liberal Democrats took control of Islington council in a by-election in December 1999.

questions.text: For what is Upper Street in Islington best known?
questions.explanation:
Restaurants.

	Islington has more restaurants than days of the year.

questions.text: What sort of market is Camden Passage?
questions.explanation:
Antiques.

	Camden Passage is in Islington, NOT the neighbouring borough of Camden.

questions.text: Which British PM lived in Islington before his or her election?
questions.explanation:
Tony Blair.

	Tony Blair lived at Richmond Crescent, Islington until he moved to 10 Downing Street. He is still sometimes called 'Islington Man' in the media.

questions.text: Which famous football team is based in Islington?
questions.explanation:
Arsenal.

	Arsenal FC was originally based near Woolwich Arsenal but moved to Highbury in Islington nearly 100 years ago.

questions.text: How many prisons are there in Islington?
questions.explanation:
One.

	One current prison - Pentonville prison for men. Holloway prison for women closed down in 2016. There is also an ancient House of Correction in Clerkenwell, but that is now a museum.

questions.text: What is the New River in Islington?
questions.explanation:
Canal.

	The New River is a canal created from the River Lee to bring fresh drinking water into Islington.
